item.title: Hacker News Top Stories: Sunday, May 18, 2025 at 7:15 PM UTC
item.description:
1. Show HN: I modeled the Voynich Manuscript with SBERT to test for structure (161 points | 40 comments)
2. Spaced repetition systems have gotten way better (479 points | 340 comments)
3. $30 Homebrew Automated Blinds Opener (60 points | 21 comments)
4. Ditching Obsidian and building my own (78 points | 99 comments)

6. Spaced Repetition Memory System (69 points | 2 comments)
7. O(n) vs. O(n^2) Startups (37 points | 34 comments)
8. Show HN: Buckaroo – Data table UI for Notebooks (40 points | 5 comments)
9. Emergent social conventions and collective bias in LLM populations (22 points | 2 comments)
10. Show HN: Hardtime.nvim – break bad habits and master Vim motions (124 points | 45 comments)
11. How the humble chestnut traced the rise and fall of the Roman Empire (17 points | 1 comment)
12. Building my childhood dream PC (54 points | 24 comments)
13. In Memoriam: John L. Young, Cryptome Co-Founder (123 points | 9 comments)
14. An Uplifting Origin of 86 (2001) (17 points | 3 comments)

19. AniSora: Open-source anime video generation model (303 points | 165 comments)
20. The RISC OS GUI (28 points | 4 comments)
21. Working with Git Patches in Apple Mail (2023) (30 points | 13 comments)
22. Paper Mechanisms (50 points | 2 comments)
23. Project Verona: Fearless Concurrency for Python (142 points | 109 comments)
24. Show HN: Chat with 19 years of HN (84 points | 47 comments)
25. The Conquest of Hell Gate [pdf] (43 points | 10 comments)
26. Lessons from Mixing Rust and Java: Fast, Safe, and Practical (105 points | 33 comments)
27. What Every Programmer Should Know About Enumerative Combinatorics (69 points | 35 comments)
28. High Available Mosquitto MQTT on Kubernetes (42 points | 18 comments)
29. Measure EEG with Arduino (22 points | 11 comments)
30. Show HN: Turn any workflow diagram into compilable, running and stateful code (91 points | 20 comments)
